Message.Msg: But Republicans can be true to their ideals of yesterday. Let the private sector grow us out of this financial malaise and reduce the size of govt and their excessive spending habits.

Topic.Title: U.S. Senate Pounded by John Boehner

Message.Msg: Echo, four more years of Obummer torture for WORKING Americans. More "things" for you liberal lemmings.

Topic.Title: U.S. Senate Pounded by John Boehner

Message.Msg: Apparently you're neither white nor male, correct? I can't speak for winholder or anyone else, but I think a spouse can be and has been called a lot worse than 'the wife'. And you know what, that doesn't mean we don't respect them or love them. You don't think they have names for us that you might not consider acceptable in your tilted world? You can be so petty and silly, I am beginning to think you may be the one living in Mom’s basement!

The Republicans made Obama a proposal this week and did he make a counter or suggest that they sit and begin work on the differences? No, they just stated that it was unacceptable and if the Republicans won't move all the countries financial problems will be their fault. An excellent example of an open and honest, willing to negotiate administration. He won the election a immediately rammed home his health care plan, little of anything else including budgets, but he did accomplish that. Now he assumes that because he won, he can do the same with the tax laws, it is his way or the highway and we all just need to get the he&& out of the way. Sorry, but that’s not leadership, this is dictatorship.

That's because so many of the them are not working and getting extended UE benefits, food stamps, free cell phones, etc. They are paying little if any taxes and don't want to work for anything less than they previously were paid, if they have ever worked at all. It may not be 47%, but the percentage is too much higher than it should be or that we can afford. Obama's efforts to 'put this country back to work' simply aren't working.

Topic.Title: T is one of top picks like crimson on apex

Message.Msg: "Then why don't the Democrats walk the walk," As I noted, the Democrats have made concrete proposals regarding the specific tax rates they want. The Republicans have come back with ANOTHER demand for closing loopholes and spending cuts, without actually naming the loopholes they want closed and the spending cuts they want. At some point, they have to name the loopholes and the spending they want cut. They have never done this, even when they were in control of Congress and the Presidency for six years.
"And that pledge does not pass legislation." Exactly. It prevents legislation from being passed. Blame Democrats for tea party stonewalling all you want. The nation knows the Party of No.

Message.Title: Both Sides are in cahoots
Message.Msg: You can bet that they won't tell us the terms and conditions of a deal before Dec 31. Reason? If they say that they will raise capital gains up to 30% on short termers after 2012, the market would crash. If they say that since they couldn't come to any agreement, and all the the Bush tax cuts expire, it shouldn't surprise anyone. The burden would be shared by all. These guys and gals need to "man up" and just say that they are holding us hostage, and apologize for a job not well done. You've got to be kidding me when they say that either side has our brst interest at heart. The onlyones that are gonna win in this deal are the lazy folks

Are the pro-bami people who infest these boards happy yet. I'm all in cash, and waiting. How come that COSCO clown ceo, who spoke at the dem convention, is borrowing money, to pre-pay his dividend before the end of the year. I hope Bami hits you with a retroactive tax. Seems like he's not willing to pay his fair share. Corporate pigs, one and all.

Topic.Title: Say it ain't so. A dem wouldn't do this.

Message.Msg: Outstanding post! Liberal Media will bury the Rice Story and Fox News, like always, will break the story to the nation. Go Fox News! Corruption is running rampant at the highest levels of Government!
